member.summary: Indicates whether the application is running in a debugging context

member.summary: The timestamp at which this application was built

member.name: P:Core.Application.ApplicationContext.HostEnvironment
member.summary: The HostEnvironment where the application is running (Dev, Test, Stage, Production)

member.name: T:Core.Application.HostEnvironment
member.summary: Specifies the Environment under which an application is running (usually obtained from a Context type object)

member.name: F:Core.Application.HostEnvironment.Undefined
member.summary: Not specified

member.name: F:Core.Application.HostEnvironment.Mock
member.summary: A Mock environment is setup to auto-mock all dependencies of all classes, and is often driven by a formatted text file to inject sets of mocked data for an application demo to run offline, or for running mock tests

member.name: F:Core.Application.HostEnvironment.Development
member.summary: The Development environment belongs to the Development Team and is the least restrictive in the environment stack

member.name: F:Core.Application.HostEnvironment.Test
member.summary: The Test environment belongs to the Testing Team and is slightly more restrictive than the Development environment

member.name: F:Core.Application.HostEnvironment.Stage
member.summary: The Stage environment belongs to the Business Team and is slightly more restrictive than the QA environment

member.name: F:Core.Application.HostEnvironment.Beta
member.summary: The Beta environment belongs to the IT and Business Team and is available for testing beta applications side-by-side with an existing version of the same application

member.name: F:Core.Application.HostEnvironment.Production
member.summary: The Production environment belongs to the Production Management Team and is very restrictive

member.name: T:Core.Application.HostEnvironmentAttribute
member.summary: This attribute give you the ability to provide additional meta-data details for a specific value in any Enum that represents runtime Environments

member.name: P:Core.Application.HostEnvironmentAttribute.IsMockInstance
member.summary: Returns true if the given EnvironmentCode represents a Mocked runtime Environment; otherwise, false

member.name: P:Core.Application.HostEnvironmentAttribute.IsDevelopmentInstance
member.summary: Returns true if the given EnvironmentCode represents a Development runtime Environment; otherwise, false

member.name: P:Core.Application.HostEnvironmentAttribute.IsTestingInstance
member.summary: Returns true if the given EnvironmentCode represents a Testing runtime Environment; otherwise, false

member.name: P:Core.Application.HostEnvironmentAttribute.IsBetaInstance
member.summary: Returns true if the given EnvironmentCode represents a Beta runtime Environment; otherwise, false

member.name: P:Core.Application.HostEnvironmentAttribute.IsProductionInstance
member.summary: Returns true if the given EnvironmentCode represents a Production runtime Environment; otherwise, false

member.name: T:Core.Caching.ICache
member.summary: A generic abstraction of a caching mechanism

member.name: M:Core.Caching.ICache.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the cache contains a specific key
member.returns: true if the provided string is found in the cache, which inheritly means there is a value cached for it; otherwise, false

member.name: P:Core.Caching.ICache.Contents
member.summary: Exposes the contents of the cache as a formatted string
member.returns: A string representing the contents of the cache

member.name: M:Core.Caching.ICache.GetOrAdd``1(System.String,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Calls the GetOrAdd() overload using the applications default CacheExpirationInHours
member.typeparam: The Type of object you are expecting to receive from the cache
member.param: Lookup key for the cache entry
Function to set the value of the cache entry if it does not exist or has expired
member.returns: The entry in the cache for the given key

member.name: M:Core.Caching.ICache.GetOrAdd``1(System.String,System.Func{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an entry from the cache if it exists. If it does not exist (or it has expired) it will use the Func you pass in to set a value in the cache for the key you specified.
member.typeparam: The Type of object you are expecting to receive from the cache
member.param: Lookup key for the cache entry
Function to set the value of the cache entry if it does not exist or has expired
Specifies how long the cache should live for before using the Func parameter to refresh the cache entrys value
member.returns: The entry in the cache for the given key

member.name: M:Core.Caching.ICache.FormatKey(System.Object[])
member.summary: Given n input arguments, this method will return a string ready to be used as a key using all standard conventions
member.returns: The formatted cache key

member.name: M:Core.Caching.ICache.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a single cache entry, by key
member.param: Lookup key for the cache entry
member.returns: The object that was cache

member.name: M:Core.Caching.ICache.RemoveAll
member.summary: Removes all cache entries, effectively clearing out the cache completely

member.name: T:Core.Caching.ICacheFactory
member.summary: Creates instances, using the default (when no name is specified) or the cache instance by name

member.name: T:Core.Data.Attributes.CommandAttribute
member.summary: This attribute provides the ability to specify meta-data about a Command, such as whether or not it will alter a data source

member.name: P:Core.Data.Attributes.CommandAttribute.IsPersistent
member.summary: Set to true if the Command you are denoting will alter a data source, such as a database; otherwise, false

member.name: T:Core.Data.Attributes.ComponentAttribute
member.summary: This attribute give you the ability to create new Components and subscribe them to existing Modules without impacting Module code (i.e. this facilitaes a loose coupling between Modules and Components)

member.name: P:Core.Data.Attributes.ComponentAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name of this Component

member.name: P:Core.Data.Attributes.ComponentAttribute.Type
member.summary: The type of this Component

member.name: P:Core.Data.Attributes.ComponentAttribute.ModuleName
member.summary: The Module this Component should be associated with. If the type is not an IModule, the Bootstrapper process will throw an Exception

member.name: T:Core.Data.Attributes.InjectableAttribute
member.summary: This attribute give you the ability to declare IoC injection behavor as meta-data on a class intended to be used in a dependeny injection context

member.name: P:Core.Data.Attributes.InjectableAttribute.MapTo
member.summary: Specifies the interface to be automattically mapped to the class with the Injectable attribute for IoC. When this value is null and a class has this attribute, it will assume the first interface on this class should be used for the mapping
member.exception: Thrown when this attribute exists on a class, but InterfaceToMap is null and no interfaces exist on the class

member.name: P:Core.Data.Attributes.InjectableAttribute.AutoWiring
member.summary: Allows the class to opt-out of the auto-wiring IoC process. This would also support any IoC auto-wiring where classes are expected to exlicitly opt-in

member.name: P:Core.Data.Attributes.InjectableAttribute.Lifetime
member.summary: The lifetime to be used when registering types for the container

member.summary: This attribute give you the ability to specify meta-data about your Module, such as a Name

member.name: P:Core.Data.Attributes.ModuleAttribute.Name
member.summary: The Name of this Module

member.name: T:Core.Data.Attributes.PluginAttribute
member.summary: This attribute give you the ability to provide meta-data for Plugin modules, which allows you to specifiy a Plugin's name and type on the ICorePlugin class

member.name: P:Core.Data.Attributes.PluginAttribute.Name
member.summary: A name that uniquely identifies this module. This will be used in the IoC auto-wiring process as a key for consuming applications to dictate which modules they're composed of

member.name: P:Core.Data.Attributes.PluginAttribute.Type
member.summary: Specifies the type of module this class represents. This will be used in the IoC auto-wiring process as a key for consuming applications to dictate which modules they're composed of

member.name: T:Core.Exceptions.CoreException
member.summary: Core Exceptions a thrown only by the Core.* assemblies. There are several overloads to support concise client code.

member.name: P:Core.Exceptions.CoreException.ErrorCode
member.summary: Error Code string to be logged; Error Codes can be found in Core.Constants.ErrorCode.*

member.name: P:Core.Exceptions.CoreException.LogLevel
member.summary: The Level at which an entry should be logged

member.name: M:Core.Exceptions.CoreException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Simple overload for providing a message as part of the exception
member.param: A brief description of what the is. This is not meant to be formatted in a specific way and is not intended to be search on. It's a human-readble descriptive note of what happened. There are other classes for providing more structure to log entries for the sake of searching and grouping

member.name: M:Core.Exceptions.CoreException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Simple overload for providing an as well as a message as part of the exception
member.param: The Error Code string to be logged; Error Codes can be found in Core.Constants.ErrorCode.* and are 4 character strings

A brief description of the . This is not meant to be formatted in a specific way and is not intended to be search on. It's a human-readble descriptive note of what happened. There are other classes (i.e. ) for providing more structure to log entries for the sake of searching and grouping

member.name: M:Core.Exceptions.CoreException.#ctor(System.Exception,System.String)
member.summary: Simple overload for providing an inner exception as well as a message as part of the exception
member.param: The inner exception being wrapped

A brief description of what the is. This is not meant to be formatted in a specific way and is not intended to be search on. It's a human-readble descriptive note of what happened. There are other classes for providing more structure to log entries for the sake of searching and grouping

member.name: M:Core.Exceptions.CoreException.#ctor(System.Exception,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Simple overload for providing an inner exception and an , as well as a message as part of the exception
member.param: The inner exception being wrapped
The Error Code string to be logged; Error Codes can be found in Core.Constants.ErrorCode.* and are 4 character strings

A brief description of what the is. This is not meant to be formatted in a specific way and is not intended to be search on. It's a human-readble descriptive note of what happened. There are other classes (i.e. ) for providing more structure to log entries for the sake of searching and grouping

member.name: T:Core.IoC.DuplicateRegistrationOption
member.summary: Used by the IoC auto-wiring process. This enum indicates how the IoC initialization process should behave when it encounters a duplicate registration.

member.name: F:Core.IoC.DuplicateRegistrationOption.Undefined
member.summary: Not specified

member.name: F:Core.IoC.DuplicateRegistrationOption.ThrowException
member.summary: When a call is made to register and a duplicate registration exists, consider it an error and throw an exception

member.name: F:Core.IoC.DuplicateRegistrationOption.OverrideExistingRegistration
member.summary: When a call is made to register and a duplicate registration exists, consider the request to be the correct registration and override the existing registration

member.name: F:Core.IoC.DuplicateRegistrationOption.IgnoreRegistrationRequest
member.summary: When a call is made to register and a duplicate registration exists, consider the existing registration to be correct and ignore the requested registration

member.name: T:Core.IoC.RegistrationLifetime
member.summary: Indicates the lifetime to be used when registering types for the container

member.name: F:Core.IoC.RegistrationLifetime.Undefined
member.summary: Not specified

member.name: F:Core.IoC.RegistrationLifetime.Singleton
member.summary: Singleton components are instantiated once, and shared between all clients.

member.name: F:Core.IoC.RegistrationLifetime.Transient
member.summary: Transient components are created on demand.

member.name: F:Core.IoC.RegistrationLifetime.PerRequest
member.summary: PerRequest components are created once per Http Request

member.summary: A generic abstraction of the Directory system

member.name: M:Core.IO.IDirectorySystem.CreateDirectory(System.IO.DirectoryInfo)
member.summary: Creates a new Directory
member.param: DirectoryInfo for the directory of interest
member.returns: Returns true if the Directory was created successfully; otherwise, false

member.name: M:Core.IO.IDirectorySystem.DeleteDirectory(System.IO.DirectoryInfo)
member.summary: Deletes an existing Directory
member.param: DirectoryInfo for the directory of interest
member.returns: Returns true if the Directory was created successfully; otherwise, false

member.name: M:Core.IO.IDirectorySystem.GetUniqueFileInfo(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Finds a unique filename for the directory you wish to store a file. This guarentees you'll be able to save a file, using a certain naming convention, in any directory you choose, regarless of whether or not a file by that same name already exists in that directory (useful on retry scenarios where files are being created)
member.param: Details about the file to generate a unique name for, such as the directory, and potential name for the file
member.returns: Returns FileInfo about the unique file to avoid ambiguity about the nature of a simpiler return type, such as a string

member.name: M:Core.IO.IDirectorySystem.IsDirectoryExists(System.IO.DirectoryInfo)
member.summary: Checks to see if a Dictory already exists
member.param: DirectoryInfo for the directory of interest
member.returns: Returns true if the given Directory exists; otherwise, false

member.name: T:Core.IO.IFileSystem
member.summary: A generic abstraction of the File system

member.name: M:Core.IO.IFileSystem.CreateFile(Core.IO.FileModel)
member.summary: Creates a file and stores it in a location to be determed by the concrete implementations of IFileSystem
member.param: Details about the file to create
member.returns: A unique identifier for the File to be retrieved in the future; a filepath, for example

member.name: M:Core.IO.IFileSystem.DeleteFile(Core.IO.FileModel)
member.summary: Deletes an existing File
member.param: Details about the file to delete
member.returns: Returns true if the Directory was deleted successfully; otherwise, false

member.name: M:Core.IO.IFileSystem.GetFile(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a file from a location to be determed by the concrete implementations of IFileSystem
member.param: A unique identifier for the File to be located; a filepath, for example
member.returns: The File that was requested

member.name: M:Core.IO.IFileSystem.IsFileExists(Core.IO.FileModel)
member.summary: Checks to see if a Dictory already exists
member.param: DirectoryInfo for the directory of interest
member.returns: Returns true if the given Directory exists; otherwise, false

member.summary: Creates instances, using the default (when no name is specified) or the cache instance by name

member.name: T:Core.Logging.LogEntry
member.summary: A generic representation of an entry in a log

member.summary: The unique identifier for this instance

member.summary: The unique identifier for a given process which can be used to tie all LogEntries for a single Process

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.LogLevel
member.summary: The Level at which this LogEntry should be logged

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.ErrorCode
member.summary: A four character representation of the type of error that occured

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.Message
member.summary: A simple message to display in the logs; no formatting is required

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.Exception
member.summary: The Exception that occured, if any

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.MethodName
member.summary: The name of the Method that was called under the context of the given LogEntry

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.MethodInput
member.summary: A serialized version of the object used as input to the Method

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.MethodOutput
member.summary: A serialized version of the object used as output to the Method

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.ApplicationName
member.summary: The name of the application for which the LogEntry is being generated

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.ChildApplicationName
member.summary: The name of the child application for which the LogEntry is being generated

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.MachineName
member.summary: The name of the machine for which the LogEntry is being generated

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.IPAddress
member.summary: The IP Address where the LogEntry is being generated

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.ProcessStep
member.summary: Used in conjunction with the ProcessGUID, this can be used to tag which step in the overall process generated this LogEntry

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.GenericIdentifier1
member.summary: Free-form string that facilitates consumers tagging LogEntries for the sake of grouping them later on

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.GenericIdentifier1Type
member.summary: The type of free-form string used in GenericIdentifier1

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.GenericIdentifier2
member.summary: Free-form string that facilitates consumers tagging LogEntries for the sake of grouping them later on

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.GenericIdentifier2Type
member.summary: The type of free-form string used in GenericIdentifier2

member.name: P:Core.Logging.LogEntry.ElapsedMilliseconds
member.summary: The total number of milliseconds that elapsed within the scope of the operation for which this LogEntry is being generated

member.name: T:Core.Logging.LogLevel
member.summary: Describes the Level at which an entry should be logged

member.name: F:Core.Logging.LogLevel.Undefined
member.summary: Not specified

member.name: F:Core.Logging.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: The Debug level designates fine-grained informational events that are most useful to debug an application

member.name: F:Core.Logging.LogLevel.Info
member.summary: The Info level designates informational messages that highlight the progress of the application at coarse-grained level

member.name: F:Core.Logging.LogLevel.Warn
member.summary: The Warn level designates potentially harmful situations

member.name: F:Core.Logging.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: The Error level designates error events that might still allow the application to continue running

member.name: F:Core.Logging.LogLevel.Fatal
member.summary: The Fatal level designates very severe error events that will presumably lead the application to abort
